H0.text: What often poisonous compound, CN, found in fruit seeds and stones, named from Greek for dark blue, comprises Carbon and Nitrogen. Cyanogen

H1.text: What often poisonous compound, CN, found in fruit seeds and stones, named from Greek for dark blue, comprises Carbon and Nitrogen. Cyanoacetylene

H2.text: What often poisonous compound, CN, found in fruit seeds and stones, named from Greek for dark blue, comprises Carbon and Nitrogen. Carbonitrile

H3.text: What often poisonous compound, CN, found in fruit seeds and stones, named from Greek for dark blue, comprises Carbon and Nitrogen. CN-

A4.text: Cyanogen was named from the Greek words for blue (kyanos) and to create (gennao).

A5.text: Cyanogen has the chemical formula (CN)2, which consists of Carbon and Nitrogen atoms.
